titles.title: A bill to amend title XI of the Social Security Act to clarify waiver authority regarding programs of all-inclusive care for the elderly (PACE programs).

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

calendar.text: Committee on Finance. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Finance. Reported by Senator Hatch with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 114-108.

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services

bill.summary: 8/5/2015--Passed Senate amended. This bill amends title XI of the Social Security Act to authorize the Department of Health and Human Services to waive applicable general and Medicaid requirements of the Program of All-Inclusive Care for Elderly (PACE) in order to conduct demonstration projects through the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovations (CMMI) that involve PACE. Prohibits HHS, however, as part of a CMMI demonstration, from waiving: (1) the requirement to offer items and services under Medicare and Medicaid without limitation to PACE program enrollees, and (2) certain requirements regarding enrollment in and disenrollment from PACE programs.
